summary: A set of high quality painting, frame and canvas resources for modders. Includes textures, PSDs and additional assets.
descriptionHtml:
[size=5][color=#FFC000][color=#C00000][size=4]Disclaimer: this "mod"contains no actual imagery (paintings, sketches o[/size][/color][color=#C00000][size=4][color=#C00000][size=4]r otherwise[/size][/color] This is intended to be a modding resource and as such, you will be expected to add said images yourself.[/size][/color]


Description:[/color][/size]

Some time ago I released a mod called "The Masters Gallery", a compilation of histories greatest paintings ported into Skyrim with fresh new resources and plans to build on the mods initial release by adding new material and resources over the following weeks.

It was on the nexus for a grand total of eight hours before I took it down. Although that mod was developed out of a genuine love and appreciation for the art, I couldn't ignore the possibility of potential copy write infringement.

I was not "forced" to remove the mod, nor was I coerced or threatened by TES's digital gate keepers, rather some people made some excellent points in the comments section regarding the issue and I felt obligated too consider them. In the end I decided to remove the mod for same reason I started it to begin with...out of respect for the medium and the artists thereof.

Needless to say, the mod is dead and I have no plans to resurrect it, but I have decided to release the mods assets, since I developed those myself and invested quite a bit of time doing so.

So, what is "HQ Frames and Canvas'"..well it's exactly what it sounds like, this a modder's resource containing the raw assets I developed for "The Masters Gallery" which includes, three frame and canvas meshes, five texture sets(for frames) eight texture sets(for canvas') and two paper texture sets(for posters and books).

In addition to these texture sets (8.8.8dds/2048x/Lossless). I've also made my PSD. files available in the "optional files" section for blending and editing purposes and have included some auxilary material like material resources and an additional filter pack in the form of a PSD. file.


[size=5][color=#FFC000]File Details:[/color][/size]

ESP File_
This is just a base-line ESP file containing the basic item/categorical information for the mods assets which can only be accessed through the creation kit. There are currently fifteen paintings (no images, just blank canvas') and two posters.
To find these assets in creation kit load the ESP file (duh), type "GalleryArt" in the filter bar and select *ALL at the bottom of the object window.

Texture Files_
There are currently 30 texture images (15 sets) All are 2048pxls and DXT_5 - 8.8.8dds.

PSD Files_
Fourteen PSD. files containing the layer/effects information for all canvas', paper(poster) and plaster.
I have not included the PSD files for the normal maps because they should be easy enough to generate any new _N.dds on your own with the surface maps.


[size=5][color=#FFC000]Inspirations:[/color][/size]

Although wasn't able to release "The Masters Gallery" or the actual image (painting) assets contained within, I am allowed to share the names of some of the artists who originally inspired the mod.

If you love art, or have ever been curious about it I'd highly recommend looking up these names.

Jules Joseph Lefebvre

Luis Ricardo Falero

Paolo Serpieri

William Etty

Frank Frezetta

John William Godward

Eugen Delcroix

Thomas Moran

Roberto Ferri

Lawrence Alma-Tadema

Jean-Léon Gérome

Titian


[size=5][color=#FFC000]Credits:[/color][/size]

Bethesda - For an awesome game.

jet4571 - For the original frame meshes.
author: BetterBecause
